title: India blocks Pakistan-based OTT platform for streaming major events
content:
ISLAMABAD, Dec 13 (APP): The Indian government imposed a ban on Pakistani-based Vidly TV`s OTT platform, apps and social media accounts in India, which has been streaming historical events, the plight of minorities under growing Hindutva menace and gaining popularity among the Indian population.
The Indian government informed to block a Pakistan-based OTT platform named ‘Vidly TV’ for broadcasting a web series on the pretext of its contents being against India’s national security and integrity.
The Indian ministry of information and broadcasting also banned the website, two mobile apps and four social media accounts of Vidly TV by issuing order using its emergency powers under IT Rules 2021, the leading Indian media outlets reported.
An Indian ministry official told media that government’s action against Pakistan-based Vidly TV followed the web series “Sevak: The Confessions.
https://www.ndtv.com/india-news/india-bans-pakistan-based-ott-platform-vidly-tv-3600390
The OTT channel`s web series showed events like Babri Mosque demolition in Ayodhya, Operation Blue Star, Malegaon blast and Samjhauta Express blast among others.
https://zeenews.india.com/technology/indian-govt-bans-pakistani-based-vidly-tv-ott-platform-apps-social-media-accounts-in-india-heres-shocking-reason-2548054.html
In June last year, India had banned 59 Chinese mobile applications including the widely-used social media platforms such as TikTok, WeChat, and Helo on the same pretext of national security.
